birds.description: Medium-sized woodpecker with striking golden-yellow cheeks and forehead contrasting with black-and-white barred back. Males have extensive red crown extending to nape; females have black crown with red only on nape.
fieldMarks: Red crown (male) or red nape only (female)
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, gardens, palm groves

birds.description: Bright orange oriole with distinctive black streaking on the back. Deep orange head and underparts with black throat and lores. Heavy, slightly curved bill. Common in open woodlands and gardens.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, gardens, woodland edges, palm trees

birds.description: Large, conspicuous black bird with bright yellow rump, wing patches, and tail base. Pale blue eye and thick pale bill. Often found in noisy flocks building pendulous nests in colonies.
fieldMarks: Black body with yellow wing patches
birds.habitat: Forest edges, plantations, gardens, often near water

birds.description: Large flycatcher with heavy dark bill. Gray-brown above with whitish underparts washed yellow on belly. Dark mask through eye. Often perches conspicuously on exposed branches.
birds.habitat: Woodland edges, riparian areas, semi-open country

birds.description: Handsome thrush with gray head, rufous-orange back, and orange-rufous underparts. Streaked throat and yellow eye-ring. Often hops on ground in shaded areas searching for invertebrates.
birds.habitat: Gardens, woodland edges, forest understory

birds.description: Small, glossy black crow endemic to western Mexico. Smaller than American Crow with proportionally smaller bill. Voice is higher-pitched and more nasal than other crows.
birds.habitat: Coastal areas, towns, agricultural land, beaches

birds.description: Medium-sized hummingbird with entirely cinnamon-rufous underparts and rufous tail. Bronzy-green above with red bill showing dark tip. Common at feeders and flowering plants.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, gardens, woodland edges, scrub

birds.description: Large finch-like bird with olive-gray upperparts and rich cinnamon-buff underparts. White supercilium and throat bordered by black moustache stripe. Heavy bill.
birds.habitat: Forest edges, second growth, gardens, hedgerows

birds.description: Large, chicken-like bird with long tail. Gray-brown head and breast with rufous belly. Red throat skin visible when calling. Very vocal at dawn with raucous cha-cha-LAC-a calls.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, second growth

birds.description: Small, richly colored wren with rufous crown, bold white supercilium, and barred underparts. Often heard before seen, giving loud cheerful duets. Skulks in dense vegetation.
birds.habitat: Dense undergrowth, thickets, forest edges

birds.description: Small rufous-brown dove with blue-gray crown and nape. Males are richer rufous; females are paler and browner. Often feeds on ground in pairs or small groups.
birds.habitat: Open areas, gardens, roadsides, agricultural land

birds.description: Spectacular large jay with long curved crest, very long graduated tail, and striking black-and-white-and-blue pattern. Black throat and upper breast. Very vocal and conspicuous.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, gardens, towns

birds.description: Olive-green warbler with gray hood and bold white eye arcs. Yellow underparts. Skulks in dense vegetation. Similar to Mourning Warbler but with distinct broken eye-ring.
birds.habitat: Dense undergrowth, thickets, forest edges

birds.description: Plain brown wren with subtle barring on wings and tail. Pale supercilium and whitish underparts. Rich, melodious song. Endemic to western Mexico.
birds.habitat: Dry forest understory, thickets, woodland edges

birds.description: Small green parakeet with orange forehead and blue crown. Bare white eye-ring. Loud, screechy calls in flight. Often in noisy flocks flying fast over treetops.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, gardens, flying over open areas

birds.description: Tiny seedeater with rounded bill. Males have dark head with white collar and cinnamon rump. Females are plain brown. Often in weedy fields and roadsides.
birds.habitat: Weedy fields, roadsides, grasslands, marsh edges

birds.description: Medium-sized flycatcher with dark cap, olive-gray back, and yellow belly. No rufous in wings or tail. Mournful whistled call. One of the smaller Myiarchus flycatchers.
birds.habitat: Forest edges, woodland, gardens with trees

birds.description: Striking trogon with yellow belly, green back, and black-and-white barred tail. Yellow eye-ring. Male has black face and throat; female has gray. Sits motionless for long periods.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, riparian forest

birds.description: Large, long-tailed rufous-chestnut cuckoo with gray belly and yellow eye-ring. Moves through vegetation like a squirrel. Red eye-ring. Often silent but gives sharp calls.
birds.habitat: Forest canopy and edges, woodland

birds.description: Tiny green parrot with short tail. Males have blue rump and wing patches; females are all green. Often in small flocks giving high-pitched chattering calls.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, gardens

birds.description: Small owl with rufous-brown plumage, streaked crown, and false eye spots on back of head. Active during day. Often detected by mobbing songbirds or its repetitive tooting call.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, cactus scrub, gardens

birds.description: Large seabird famous for its bright blue feet used in courtship displays. Brown above with white patches, white below. Long pointed bill. Plunge-dives for fish.
birds.habitat: Coastal waters, rocky islands, offshore

birds.description: Attractive sparrow with bold black-and-white striped head and rufous back. Plain gray underparts. Often feeds on ground in dry brushy areas.
fieldMarks: Bold black and white head stripes
birds.habitat: Dry scrub, brushy areas, woodland edges

birds.description: Small, compact finch-like bird. Male has blue-black upperparts and yellow underparts with rufous belly. Female is olive-green above with pale yellowish underparts.
birds.habitat: Forest canopy, woodland edges, fruiting trees

birds.description: Small Buteo with two color morphs. Light morph has white underparts with dark hood; dark morph is all dark. Soars over forest edges hunting small birds.
birds.habitat: Forest edges, soaring over canopy and clearings

birds.description: Tiny seedeater. Breeding males are glossy blue-black with distinctive display flights. Females and non-breeding males are streaky brown. Common in weedy areas.
birds.habitat: Weedy fields, roadsides, grasslands, agricultural areas

birds.description: Large forest falcon with short rounded wings and long tail. Several color morphs. White collar on nape. Barred tail. Often heard more than seen giving loud yelping calls.
birds.habitat: Dense forest interior, forest edges

birds.description: Striking blue-gray bird with black mask and red eye. Excellent mimic like other mockingbirds. Often skulks in dense vegetation but can be conspicuous when singing.
birds.habitat: Forest understory, dense thickets, gardens

birds.description: Handsome jay with black hood, blue back, and pale blue underparts. Yellow eye and legs. Endemic to western Mexico. Often in noisy family groups.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Distinctive falcon with buffy head, dark mask, and barred wings and tail. Named for its loud laughing calls that accelerate and rise in pitch. Snake specialist.
birds.habitat: Forest edges, woodland, semi-open areas

birds.description: Colorful trogon with red belly, green back, and coppery tail. Male has black face and green chest; female has gray face and chest. White chest band. Sits motionless.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, riparian areas

birds.description: Bright yellow vireo with olive-green back and no wing bars. Yellow supercilium and underparts. Endemic to western Mexico. Active in forest canopy.
birds.habitat: Forest canopy, woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Large swallow with glossy blue-black upperparts and gray breast fading to white belly. Forked tail. Often nests in buildings. Catches insects in graceful flight.
birds.habitat: Towns, open areas near buildings, flying over fields

birds.description: Green hummingbird with rufous in wings and tail. Grayish belly with green chest. Red-based bill. Aggressive at feeders. Found at middle and higher elevations.
birds.habitat: Mountain forest edges, gardens with flowers

birds.description: Bizarre heron with massive broad scoop-like bill. Gray and black above with rufous belly. Large dark eyes for nocturnal hunting. Often roosts in dense vegetation.
birds.habitat: Mangroves, wooded swamps, stream edges

birds.description: Small thrush with orange bill and legs, gray-brown above and pale below with grayish breast. Beautiful flute-like song usually heard at dawn and dusk.
birds.habitat: Forest understory, shaded ravines, coffee plantations

birds.description: Beautiful bird with rufous crown, turquoise eyebrow, and long racquet-tipped tail. Green back and blue flight feathers. Sits motionless then swings tail like pendulum.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, ravines, gardens

birds.description: Shy thrush with brown back, gray underparts, and white eye-ring. Famous for extraordinarily beautiful flute-like song. Often heard but difficult to see.
birds.habitat: Mountain forest, pine-oak woodland, shaded ravines

birds.description: Small flycatcher with distinctive pointed crest and orange-cinnamon underparts. Olive-brown above with wing bars. Active and often in pairs. Higher elevation species.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Large seabird similar to Brown Booby but with white belly extending higher. Breeds on offshore islands. Plunge-dives for fish. Recently split from Brown Booby.
birds.habitat: Coastal waters, offshore islands

birds.description: Active warbler with distinctive head pattern - yellow crown stripe bordered by black, and white supercilium. Yellow underparts. Frequently fans its tail.
birds.habitat: Dense understory near streams, ravines, forest

birds.description: Dark thrush with slate-gray upperparts, white throat with dark streaks, and rufous-orange belly. Yellow eye-ring and bill. Often feeds on ground in shade.
birds.habitat: Forest, woodland, gardens, coffee plantations

birds.description: Small flycatcher with olive-green upperparts, yellow belly, and concealed yellow crown patch. White eye-ring. Often sluggish and easily overlooked in canopy.
birds.habitat: Forest canopy, woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Slender raptor with deeply curved bill specialized for eating apple snails. Males are dark slate with red legs and face; females are brown with streaked underparts.
birds.habitat: Freshwater marshes, lake edges with snails

birds.description: Handsome quail with scaled underparts and golden-brown crest curving forward. Gray and rufous plumage with intricate pattern. Endemic to western Mexico. Often in coveys.
birds.habitat: Dry scrub, brushy hillsides, woodland edges

birds.description: Small owl similar to Ferruginous Pygmy-Owl but grayer and less rufous. Active during day. Has false eyespots on back of head. Often detected by repetitive tooting calls.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, thorn forest, woodland

birds.description: Small hummingbird with bold white ear stripe. Male has violet-blue crown and green throat; female is green above with spotted underparts. Often at higher elevations.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain meadows, forest edges

birds.description: Large sparrow with rufous crown and nape, white throat, and gray breast with dark central spot. White eye-ring. Endemic to western Mexico. Feeds on ground in pairs.
birds.habitat: Dry forest understory, brushy areas, woodland edges

birds.description: Small Empidonax flycatcher with white throat, olive-brown upperparts, and yellowish belly. Eye-ring and wing bars. Often near streams in mountains.
birds.habitat: Stream edges, wet areas in mountain forest

birds.description: Medium-sized Myiarchus flycatcher with gray throat and breast, yellow belly, and rufous in tail. Very similar to Ash-throated but with different call and mouth color.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, thorn scrub, woodland edges

birds.description: Large finch with massive pale bill. Males are bright golden-yellow with black wings and white wing patches. Females are olive-yellow and streaked. Loud whistled song.
birds.habitat: Forest edges, woodland, gardens with trees

birds.description: Gray-headed vireo with olive back, white spectacles, and two white wing bars. Yellow flanks. Winter visitor from western North America. Deliberate foraging style.
birds.habitat: Oak woodland, forest edges, gardens with trees

birds.description: Large woodpecker with gray crown and nape, golden-olive back, and barred underparts. Red moustache stripe (male). Pale eye. Often feeds on ground like flicker.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Striking jay with black hood, purplish-blue back, and yellow underparts. Yellow eye. Endemic to western Mexico. Often in noisy family groups.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Stunning bunting endemic to western Mexico. Male has turquoise-blue upperparts, yellow-green crown, and orange breast. Female is greenish-yellow. Often in weedy areas.
birds.habitat: Brushy areas, dry scrub, weedy fields, forest edges

birds.description: Medium-sized hummingbird with distinctive white vent. Male is glittering green with violet-blue crown. Female has gray underparts. Endemic to western Mexico.
birds.habitat: Humid forest, forest edges, mountain slopes

birds.description: Small green parrot with white forehead and red around eye and on wing. Male has red on shoulders. Often in noisy flocks flying over at dawn and dusk.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, flying over open areas

birds.description: Elegant bird with tall pointed crest, gray body, and yellow undertail. Long tail with white outer feathers. Often in flocks feeding on berries or catching insects.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Large black hawk with single white tail band. Yellow cere and legs. Immature is streaky brown. Often perches near water hunting for crabs, fish, and reptiles.
fieldMarks: All black with white tail band
birds.habitat: Forest near water, mangroves, rivers, wetland edges

birds.description: Active warbler with rufous cap and cheeks, white supercilium, and yellow underparts. Often holds tail cocked. Constantly moving through low vegetation.
birds.habitat: Brushy hillsides, forest edges, dense second growth

birds.description: Endemic hummingbird with golden-green crown, straight red bill with dark tip. Bronzy-green above, whitish below. Male has glittering throat. Recently split as endemic species.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, gardens

birds.description: Slender gray hawk with long orange legs and unique double-jointed knees for probing tree cavities. White tail bands. Often seen reaching into holes for prey.
birds.habitat: Forest, woodland, often near water

birds.description: Secretive but beautiful bird. Male has black upperparts with rosy-pink underparts and supercilium. Female is brown with buff supercilium. Loud distinctive song.
birds.habitat: Dense undergrowth, thickets, forest edges

birds.description: Striking oriole with orange body, black hood extending to upper back, and black wings and tail. Black vent area. Endemic to Mexico and Central America.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Tiny pale gray warbler with rufous rump and rufous crown patch (often hidden). Whitish underparts. One of the smallest warblers. Often in mesquite and riparian areas.
birds.habitat: Dry scrub, mesquite woodland, riparian areas

birds.description: Brilliant tanager with flame-orange body (male) and streaked back. White wing bars. Female is olive-yellow with streaked back. Found in mountain forests.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Distinctive hummingbird with violet-blue crown, snow-white underparts, and red bill. No green on underparts. Immatures have dusky crown. Often at feeders.
birds.habitat: Riparian woodland, canyons, gardens with feeders

birds.description: Tiny gray bird with long tail. Breeding male has black cap; female and non-breeding male have gray crown. White eye-ring. Active in dry scrub.
birds.habitat: Dry thorn scrub, desert edges, dry woodland

birds.description: Green parrot with lilac crown and forehead, red forehead patch, and pale bill. Endemic to western Mexico. Often in noisy flocks. Threatened by habitat loss.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland, flying over open areas

birds.description: Large dark duck with white wing patches visible in flight. Wild birds have bare red facial skin and knob on bill. Often perches in trees. Domestic birds vary widely.
birds.habitat: Forested wetlands, rivers, ponds, mangroves

birds.description: Tiny seedeater. Males have rufous underparts, gray head, and small pale bill. Females are plain brown. Found in weedy areas and grasslands.
birds.habitat: Weedy fields, grasslands, marsh edges

birds.description: Secretive rail with rufous head and neck, olive-brown back, and gray underparts. Red eye, greenish bill, and red legs. Often heard more than seen in mangroves.
birds.habitat: Mangroves, coastal wetlands, flooded forest

birds.description: Small finch with black hood (male), yellow wing bars, and yellow patches in wings and tail. Female has olive head with streaking. Often in small flocks in pines.
birds.habitat: Pine-oak forest, mountain woodland, forest edges

birds.description: Large hummingbird with very long bill, white moustache stripe, and purple gorget. White patch on lower back visible in flight. Often perches conspicuously.
birds.habitat: Dry forest, woodland edges, gardens, open areas

birds.description: Secretive ground-dwelling cuckoo with long tail, buff underparts, and blue eye-ring. Rufous wings visible in flight. Runs on ground through dense vegetation.
birds.habitat: Dense undergrowth, dry forest floor, thickets
